result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi M Drescher Irvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs of $268.00 to be paid as condition of probation.

DNA surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as condition of probation.

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment.

Defendant Heidi M Irvin in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard 14CF49 & 12CF522. Defendant plead no contest to count 1 in 12CF522 & 14CF49.  Court will accept plea and adjudge guilty and enter JOC.  In Count 1 in 12CF522 court imposes: Sentence withheld 3 years probation with conditions: $2188.50, DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge, 6 month conditional  jail w huber with good time, transfer to Grant County allowed.  30 month revocation & IID, AODA & treatment, not poss/cons alcohol.  Court imposes in count 1 in 14CF49: Sentence withheld 3 years probation with conds: court costs $518.00.  Jail credit to be determined.   Report immediately. In 12CF522 counts 2-4 dismissed off the record.
